list-item.p: comparative quality characterization based on previously established critical attributes ( 30);
defining the potential impact of identified differences in the biodistribution, biological activity/efficacy, and safety using modeling and simulation approaches ( 31);
pre-clinically confirming in vitro (potentially followed by in vivo) the anticipated consequences of quality-related differences ( 32);
clinically confirming the preclinical findings through comparative efficacy (and safety) studies ( 33);
establishing a post-marketing surveillance program for the safety of the putatively approved similar NBCD.
